trans-unit.source: Test Order Scheduling

seg-source.mrk: Test Order Scheduling

trans-unit.source: Testing is an operation of quality control. Like other operations, this activity needs to be scheduled and monitored. Scheduling of test activities is the process of arranging, controlling and optimizing work and workloads in a quality control process. Scheduling is used to coordinate activities with other operations.

seg-source.mrk: Testing is an operation of quality control.
Like other operations, this activity needs to be scheduled and monitored.
Scheduling of test activities is the process of arranging, controlling and optimizing work and workloads in a quality control process.
Scheduling is used to coordinate activities with other operations.

trans-unit.source: Testing is a tool that can have a significant impact on the efficiency of other supply chain processes, like manufacturing and inventory management.

seg-source.mrk: Testing is a tool that can have a significant impact on the efficiency of other supply chain processes, like manufacturing and inventory management.

trans-unit.source: The scheduling function in cc|quality management is available on Test Orders and Test Incidents. Additionally, Test Activities can be assigned to Test Order Properties. Therefore, when Test Orders are created, the system can schedule the Test Orders based on the longest Test Activity.

seg-source.mrk: The scheduling function in cc|quality management is available on Test Orders and Test Incidents.
Additionally, Test Activities can be assigned to Test Order Properties.
Therefore, when Test Orders are created, the system can schedule the Test Orders based on the longest Test Activity.

trans-unit.source: Rescheduling can be initiated from a batch (also available from Test Order/Test Incident) or by changing the Starting Date/Time on the document.

seg-source.mrk: Rescheduling can be initiated from a batch (also available from Test Order/Test Incident) or by changing the Starting Date/Time on the document.

trans-unit.source: In cc|quality management, the scheduling function is currently a tool for planning only; primarily, to calculate the start and end times for the following processes:

seg-source.mrk: In cc|quality management, the scheduling function is currently a tool for planning only; primarily, to calculate the start and end times for the following processes:

trans-unit.source: Test Activities Overview

trans-unit.source: Test Activities are copied through the schedule of record creation like it is executed for Test Properties: Test Activity → Test Plan Activity → Test Order Activity.

seg-source.mrk: Test Activities are copied through the schedule of record creation like it is executed for Test Properties: Test Activity → Test Plan Activity → Test Order Activity.

trans-unit.source: While the Test Activity contains general information like the Code and Description fields, the Test Plan Activity contains the Execution Time and Exec. Time Unit of Meas. Code fields.

seg-source.mrk: While the Test Activity contains general information like the Code and Description fields, the Test Plan Activity contains the Execution Time and Exec.
Time Unit of Meas.
Code fields.

trans-unit.source: Master Data Setup

seg-source.mrk: Master Data Setup

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the various master data set up required to use Test Order Scheduling.

seg-source.mrk: This topic describes the various master data set up required to use Test Order Scheduling.

trans-unit.source: Quality Management Setup

seg-source.mrk: Quality Management Setup

trans-unit.source: To calculate the dates for all inspection processes, the Production Order calculation is used based on Test Activities. Therefore, a Simulated Production Order is created along with each Test Order as a temporary calculation. This production order uses a dummy item and default work center to handle the calculations, and then is deleted once the starting/ending dates are added to the Test Order.

seg-source.mrk: To calculate the dates for all inspection processes, the Production Order calculation is used based on Test Activities.
Therefore, a Simulated Production Order is created along with each Test Order as a temporary calculation.
This production order uses a dummy item and default work center to handle the calculations, and then is deleted once the starting/ending dates are added to the Test Order.

trans-unit.source: The fields needed to use the production order calculation function are defined in the Quality Management Setup page.

seg-source.mrk: The fields needed to use the production order calculation function are defined in the Quality Management Setup page.

trans-unit.source: : Fields related to Test Order Scheduling in Quality Management Setup

seg-source.mrk: : Fields related to Test Order Scheduling in Quality Management Setup

trans-unit.source: The dummy item is used as the item for the Simulated Production Order and the Work Center is used as the default if one is not assigned later in the scheduling process.

seg-source.mrk: The dummy item is used as the item for the Simulated Production Order and the Work Center is used as the default if one is not assigned later in the scheduling process.

trans-unit.source: Resources

seg-source.mrk: Resources

trans-unit.source: Resources are assigned to specific Test Activities in the Test Activities page (refer to topic “Test Activities” on page 1). There is no special set up in the Resource Card, other than the Work Center No. field, which links the resource to a work center for the test activities.

seg-source.mrk: Resources are assigned to specific Test Activities in the Test Activities page (refer to topic “Test Activities” on page 1).
There is no special set up in the Resource Card, other than the Work Center No.
field, which links the resource to a work center for the test activities.

trans-unit.source: : Work Center No. field in Resource Card (field hidden by default)

seg-source.mrk: : Work Center No.
field in Resource Card (field hidden by default)

trans-unit.source: The Resource and related Work Center are automatically assigned when an activity is assigned to Test Plan Properties. Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#Test" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Activities in Test Plan” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: The Resource and related Work Center are automatically assigned when an activity is assigned to Test Plan Properties.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="#Test" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Test Activities in Test Plan” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Work Center

seg-source.mrk: Work Center

trans-unit.source: There is no special set up in the Work Center Card, but it needs capacity for production order calculation. If no work center is assigned in the Resource, then the Work Center assigned in the Default Sched. Work Center No. field in Quality Management Setup is used.

seg-source.mrk: There is no special set up in the Work Center Card, but it needs capacity for production order calculation.
If no work center is assigned in the Resource, then the Work Center assigned in the <span class="Bold">Default Sched.
Work Center No.
field in Quality Management Setup is used.

trans-unit.source: : Work Center Card for Test Order Scheduling

seg-source.mrk: : Work Center Card for Test Order Scheduling

trans-unit.source: Important

seg-source.mrk: Important

trans-unit.source: The work center assigned to the Default Sched. Work Center No. field in Quality Management Setup is the same as the one assigned to a Resource for Test Order Scheduling.

seg-source.mrk: The work center assigned to the<span class="Bold"> Default Sched.
Work Center No.
field in Quality Management Setup is the same as the one assigned to a Resource for Test Order Scheduling.

trans-unit.source: Items

seg-source.mrk: Items

trans-unit.source: In addition to the dummy item needed for calculation, the raw material item to be tested has special set up requirements as well.

seg-source.mrk: In addition to the dummy item needed for calculation, the raw material item to be tested has special set up requirements as well.

trans-unit.source: The dummy item includes basic information needed to generate the proper calculation. It is recommend to include posting groups, rounding precisions higher than 1, replenishment from Production Orders, and item tracking.

seg-source.mrk: The dummy item includes basic information needed to generate the proper calculation.
It is recommend to include posting groups, rounding precisions higher than 1, replenishment from Production Orders, and item tracking.

trans-unit.source: Test Activity W001 for inspecting liquids has been assigned to the first two Test Properties, and the other two activities (W002 and W004 for packaging and receiving, respectively) have been assigned to the remaining properties.

trans-unit.source: : Test Activities assigned to Test Properties

seg-source.mrk: : Test Activities assigned to Test Properties

trans-unit.source: The assumption for the calculation is that these tests are done in parallel, not in sequence, but all need the complete testing time. This means that all tests begin at the same time and the testing operation that needs the longest time will determine the ending date of the test activity.

seg-source.mrk: The assumption for the calculation is that these tests are done in parallel, not in sequence, but all need the complete testing time.
This means that all tests begin at the same time and the testing operation that needs the longest time will determine the ending date of the test activity.

trans-unit.source: Incoming Goods Inspection

seg-source.mrk: Incoming Goods Inspection

trans-unit.source: When goods are received at a company’s warehouse, the time it takes from arrival to the testing needs to be considered in the testing process. Individual testing processes take different amounts of time as well, and need to be considered in the testing process. With Test Order Scheduling, these time frames are collected based on the test activities assigned to the test plans, and then start and end dates for the testing process are calculated based on the duration of those times.

seg-source.mrk: When goods are received at a company’s warehouse, the time it takes from arrival to the testing needs to be considered in the testing process.
Individual testing processes take different amounts of time as well, and need to be considered in the testing process.

With Test Order Scheduling, these time frames are collected based on the test activities assigned to the test plans, and then start and end dates for the testing process are calculated based on the duration of those times.

trans-unit.source: Example – Calculate Schedule for Test Order from Purchase Receipt

seg-source.mrk: Example – Calculate Schedule for Test Order from Purchase Receipt

trans-unit.source: The Incoming Goods Inspection item described in topic <MadCap:xref href="#Master" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Master Data Setup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> is used in this example. This item is ordered and received in the Quality Warehouse, which requires warehouse receipt processing.

seg-source.mrk: The Incoming Goods Inspection item described in topic <MadCap:xref href="#Master" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Master Data Setup” on page 1</MadCap:xref> is used in this example.
This item is ordered and received in the Quality Warehouse, which requires warehouse receipt processing.

trans-unit.source: Note the following:

seg-source.mrk: Note the following:

trans-unit.source: The Starting Time is 11:50 AM, not the posting time of 11:40 AM, due to the 10 minute wait time assigned in the Test Plan Setup for this item.

seg-source.mrk: The Starting Time is 11:50 AM, not the posting time of 11:40 AM, due to the 10 minute wait time assigned in the Test Plan Setup for this item.

trans-unit.source: The Ending Time is 12:05 PM, because the longest testing activity was 15 minutes: 11:40 + 25 minutes (10 minute wait time and 15 minute testing time) = 12:05 PM.

seg-source.mrk: The Ending Time is 12:05 PM, because the longest testing activity was 15 minutes: 11:40 + 25 minutes (10 minute wait time and 15 minute testing time) = 12:05 PM.

trans-unit.source: As previously stated, the calculation of starting and ending dates/times is to be used for planning purposes. These times have no further planning or scheduling functionality.

These times have no further planning or scheduling functionality.

trans-unit.source: Manufacturing Inspection

seg-source.mrk: Manufacturing Inspection

trans-unit.source: The same functionality of Test Order Scheduling is also available in manufacturing inspection, except the test activities can be set up to start at the beginning, in parallel or at the end of the operation. This set up is defined in the Test Order Relevance field in the Routing lines. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: The same functionality of Test Order Scheduling is also available in manufacturing inspection, except the test activities can be set up to start at the beginning, in parallel or at the end of the operation.
This set up is defined in the Test Order Relevance field in the Routing lines.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Start – The Test Order begins with the starting of the Operation and will be executed independently.

seg-source.mrk: Start – The Test Order begins with the starting of the Operation and will be executed independently.

trans-unit.source: Ending – The Test Order begins with the Ending (Date/Time) of the Operation and will be executed independently.

seg-source.mrk: Ending – The Test Order begins with the Ending (Date/Time) of the Operation and will be executed independently.

trans-unit.source:
Process – The Test Order accompanies the Operation or the Operation is created for the testing process:
  • Test Order Starting Date-Time and Ending Date-Time must concur with the Starting Date-Time and Ending Date-Time of the operation. When the Test Order Activity times are calculated, these values are copied to the Test Order Activity.
  • Refresh Prod. Order must recalculate the related Test Order.

seg-source.mrk: Process – The Test Order accompanies the Operation or the Operation is created for the testing process:
Test Order Starting Date-Time and Ending Date-Time must concur with the Starting Date-Time and Ending Date-Time of the operation.
When the Test Order Activity times are calculated, these values are copied to the Test Order Activity.
<li>Refresh Prod.
Order must recalculate the related Test Order.

trans-unit.source: : Routing with Test Order Relevance and Test Plan No. for manufacturing inspection

seg-source.mrk: : Routing with Test Order Relevance and Test Plan No.
for manufacturing inspection

trans-unit.source: The Test Plan Setup for the routing operation has three test properties: two are assigned on the first Test Property Set and one on the second Test Property Set.

seg-source.mrk: The Test Plan Setup for the routing operation has three test properties: two are assigned on the first Test Property Set and one on the second Test Property Set.

trans-unit.source: : Test Plan Activities assigned to Test Plan for manufacturing inspection routing operation

seg-source.mrk: : Test Plan Activities assigned to Test Plan for manufacturing inspection routing operation

trans-unit.source: After creation of the Test Order, the Starting and Ending dates/times are calculated based on the Source Type and the duration in the Test Order Activities.

seg-source.mrk: After creation of the Test Order, the Starting and Ending dates/times are calculated based on the Source Type and the duration in the Test Order Activities.

trans-unit.source: The Starting Date-Time for a Prod. Order Routing Line is determined as described above. If Test Order Relevance = Process is used, the Ending Date-Time is determined from the Ending Date-Time of the Prod. Order Routing.

seg-source.mrk: The Starting Date-Time for a Prod.
Order Routing Line is determined as described above.
If Test Order Relevance = Process is used, the Ending Date-Time is determined from the Ending Date-Time of the Prod.
Order Routing.

trans-unit.source: Rescheduling

seg-source.mrk: Rescheduling

trans-unit.source: It is possible to reschedule Test Orders and test incidents from the respective pages.

seg-source.mrk: It is possible to reschedule Test Orders and test incidents from the respective pages.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: Changing the Start Date in either the Test Order or Test Incident will cause the automatic recalculation of the Test Order(s).

seg-source.mrk: Changing the Start Date in either the Test Order or Test Incident will cause the automatic recalculation of the Test Order(s).

trans-unit.source: Reschedule Test Orders

seg-source.mrk: Reschedule Test Orders

trans-unit.source: In the Test Orders page, select a single or multiple Test Orders that need to be rescheduled and then click Reschedule Test Orders on the ribbon. All selected Test Orders that have Status = Created are updated as follows:

seg-source.mrk: In the Test Orders page, select a single or multiple Test Orders that need to be rescheduled and then click Reschedule Test Orders on the ribbon.
All selected Test Orders that have Status = Created are updated as follows:

trans-unit.source: The Starting Date-Time is updated

seg-source.mrk: The Starting Date-Time is updated

trans-unit.source: The Ending Date-Time is recalculated (by validating Starting Date-Time)

seg-source.mrk: The Ending Date-Time is recalculated (by validating Starting Date-Time)

trans-unit.source: Reschedule Test Incidents

seg-source.mrk: Reschedule Test Incidents

trans-unit.source: In the Test Incidents page, select a single or multiple test incidents that need to be rescheduled and then click Reschedule Test Incidents on the ribbon. All selected Test Incidents with Test Orders that have Status = Created are updated as follows:

seg-source.mrk: In the Test Incidents page, select a single or multiple test incidents that need to be rescheduled and then click Reschedule Test Incidents on the ribbon.
All selected Test Incidents with Test Orders that have Status = Created are updated as follows:

trans-unit.source: The Starting Date-Time is updated

seg-source.mrk: The Starting Date-Time is updated

trans-unit.source:
The Ending Date-Time is recalculated (by validating Starting Date-Time):
  • On the Test Order
  • On the Test Incidents

seg-source.mrk: The Ending Date-Time is recalculated (by validating Starting Date-Time):
• On the Test Order
• On the Test Incidents

trans-unit.source: Since the Test Incident is updated from the underlying Test Order, all Test Orders for an Incident must start at the same date/time and end at the same date/time. Calculation is then based on the first Test Order and the result is copied to the other Test Orders with the same Incident No. and the Test Incident itself.

seg-source.mrk: Since the Test Incident is updated from the underlying Test Order, all Test Orders for an Incident must start at the same date/time and end at the same date/time.
Calculation is then based on the first Test Order and the result is copied to the other Test Orders with the same Incident No.
and the Test Incident itself.

trans-unit.source: Note

seg-source.mrk: Note

trans-unit.source: When the Starting Date-Time is changed in a Production Order, the Date-Time will be synchronized when the “Reschedule Test Incident” function is run.

seg-source.mrk: When the Starting Date-Time is changed in a Production Order, the Date-Time will be synchronized when the “Reschedule Test Incident” function is run.

trans-unit.source: Filters in Change Test Order Status

seg-source.mrk: Filters in Change Test Order Status

trans-unit.source: The Starting Date / Ending Date are available as filters in the Change Test Order Status function.

seg-source.mrk: The Starting Date / Ending Date are available as filters in the Change Test Order Status function.
